abstract: Paper by group of economists asserts Federal Reserve's attempts to be more transparent on its policy is giving investors false confidence and setting up markets for turbulent disappointments when plans alter; says Fed should halt discussion of timing of policy moves.

headline.print_headline: Fed’s Transparency on Policy Is Questioned
headline.main: Fed’s Transparency May Give Investors False Confidence, Economists Say

snippet: A paper by a group of economists argues that the Federal Reserve’s efforts to speak more clearly about its plans for monetary policy set up markets for disappointments.
lead_paragraph: A paper by a group of economists argues that the Federal Reserve’s efforts to speak more clearly about its plans for monetary policy set up markets for disappointments.
